info.description:
Use this API to get information about and manage an Indeed employer's sponsored job campaigns.

Authentication

To get API credentials, see Authentication.

Deprecated resources

If a resource in this document is marked deprecated, we advise you to update your integration and stop using it. Deprecated resources will no longer be available in the future.

Limited-release (beta) resources

If a resource in this document is marked limited-release (beta), it is not available to all consumers of this API. The resource is available to particular API users by invitation only.

Rate limiting

Indeed applies rate limiting to this API. This ensures system stability against unauthorized or unexpected use.

Contact Us

For further questions, not answered in this document, send an email to ads-api@indeed.com.
info.title: Sponsored Job Campaigns API

get.summary: Get an employer's Indeed advertiser account information.
get.description:
Get an employer's Indeed advertiser account information.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/account?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

get.summary: Get a list of advertiser subaccounts
get.description:
Get a complete list of advertiser subaccounts.
 

Individual Employers
Not available for Individual Employers

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), get a complete list of all subaccounts associated with your account.

post.description:
Create a new advertiser subaccount.
 

Individual Employers
Not available for Individual Employers

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), create a new subaccount associated with your account.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email for the subaccount. Example: subaccount@advertiser.com

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: The 3-letter currency code used for the subaccount. Example: USD

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The 2-letter language code used for the subaccount. Example: en

parameters.name: employeeCount
parameters.description: The number of employees. Possible values are: 1-49, 50-149, 150-249, 250-499, 500-749, 750-999, 1000+

get.description:
Get an employer's monthly jobs budget.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/account/budget?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

patch.description:
To update an employer's monthly jobs budget, pass a new numeric value for jobsMonthlyBudget in the request body.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/account/budget?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

get.summary: Get a list of an employer's campaigns and their statuses
get.description:
Get a list of an employer's campaigns and their statuses. The results may be paginated. For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/campaigns?start=784e4acec9x100z2&perPage=12&type=SOURCE&status=ACTIVE

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/campaigns?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries displayed on one page.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The ID of the starting campaign in the response.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The job status. To filter the results by job status, pass either ACTIVE, DELETED, PAUSED or ALL.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of job. To filter the results by job type, pass either SOURCE or HOSTED.

get.summary: Get key dates of an employer's campaign
get.description:
Get key date information of an employer's campaign.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies

For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/campaigns/Av16isrH7Q6odKYa?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The campaign ID

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

get.summary: Get campaign statistics for a date range or a list of campaign dates.
get.description:
If you pass a date range using the startDate and endDate query parameters, this endpoint returns campaign statistics for that date range, similar to the v1/campaigns/<campaignId>/stats/{date} endpoint. If you pass a start date using the start parameter, you get a list of campaign entry dates.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

https://employers.qa.indeed.net/api/v1/stats?startDate=2018-06-01&endDate=2018-06-02&v=2

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The campaign ID

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed `advertiserId`.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: (Optional) The start of the date range, inclusive. This returns campaign statistics for the date range endpoint. Use the merge parameter to merge the statistics into one campaign statistic response that is a sum of statistics for the date range.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: (Optional) The end of the date range, exclusive

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: (Optional) The start date. This returns a list of campaign entry dates starting with the start date inclusive.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description: (Optional) Whether to merge the campaign statistic results. Possible values are true and false.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries displayed on one page.

get.summary: Get a campaign's traffic statistics for a particular date
get.description:
Get a sponsored job's campaign traffic statistics for a particular date.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/campaigns/Av16isrH7Q6odKYa/stats/2019-02-25?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: The campaign ID

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`, for which you would like to see campaign traffic statistics. Pass this parameter in the path. For example, `/campaigns/Av16isrH7Q6odKYa/stats/2019-02-25`.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed `advertiserId`.

Date.description: The date of the recorded campaign traffic statistics

Clicks.description: The number of sponsored clicks for the campaign on the specified day

Impressions.description: The number of people who viewed the sponsored campaign on that day

Conversions.description: The number of applications resulting from direct clicks on your ad campaign on the specified day.

AveragePage.description: The ratio of ad clicks to impressions, or the click-through rate.

get.summary: Request a detailed campaign traffic report for a specified date range.
get.description:
Note: This is a limited-release API. It is currently in Beta test status.
 

Use this resource to request a link to a detailed report. A successful request returns HTTP status code 202 ACCEPTED and a Location header containing the path to the report. The report is in CSV format. The path to the report uses the /v1/stats/{reportId} resource. Refer to this resource for more information.

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/stats?startDate=2019-02-25&endDate=2019-02-28&advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the campaign traffic report, inclusive, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date of the campaign traffic report, exclusive, in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description:
The report version.
`1` - Legacy version 1
`2` - Legacy version 2 containing the Ad ID column
`3` - Legacy version 3 containing the Campaign ID and Ad ID columns
`4` - The preferred report version containing the Campaign ID

parameters.name: hourlyBreakdown
parameters.description: This parameter has been deprecated and is no longer used.

get.summary: Get a detailed campaign traffic report.
get.description:
Note: This is a limited-release API. It is currently in Beta test status.
 

To retrieve the report, make a GET request to the report URL. For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/stats/68dd7bee34c4846dfea43875405836

If the response is 202, check back later.
If the response is 200, you'll receive the CSV formatted report.
Example report

Ad ID,Advertisement,Job,Job Reference Number,Platform,Clicks,Impressions,Conversions,Spend (currency)
ecc0e827cc1650c1,"Hand Model",D6US908,mobile,4.0,233,1.0,3.43 (USD)

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The ID of the report that the v1/stats/ resource returns in a location header.

parameters.name: v
parameters.description:
The report version.
`1` - Legacy version 1
`2` - Legacy version 2 containing the Ad ID column
`3` - Legacy version 3 containing the Campaign ID and Ad ID columns
`4` - The preferred report version containing the Campaign ID

get.summary: Get the statuses of an employers jobs hosted on indeed.com
get.description:
Get the statuses of an employers jobs hosted on indeed.com.
 

Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example:

http://localhost:9292/v1/hostedjobs?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries displayed on one page.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset of the hosted jobs list.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The job status. To filter the results by job status, pass either ACTIVE, DELETED, PAUSED or ALL.

get.summary: Get the details of a single job
get.description:
Get the details of an employer's jobs hosted on indeed.com
Individual Employers
The advertiserId parameter is not required.

Ad Agencies
If you represent multiple Indeed employers (have a master account), pass an employer's advertiserId.
For example: 

`http://localhost:9292/v1/hostedjobs/9171a76ffcf3?advertiserId=acd7ac45363e5e14`

Use the subaccounts resource to get a complete list of your clients' advertiser IDs.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The job ID

parameters.name: advertiserId
parameters.description: (Optional) If you represent multiple employers (have a master account), pass an employer's Indeed advertiserId.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the response. It can be `application/json`, `json text/csv` or `csv`.

contact.description: The employer's primary point of contact

status.description: The HTTP status code of the request.

errors.description: Any errors associated with the request. If there are no errors, the value of `errors` is `null`.

type.description: The name of the error, such as `RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND`.

description.description: More details describing the error, such as `Couldn't locate the requested resource`.

rootLocation.description: The root URL of the relative paths in the response.

perPage.description: The maximum number of entries displayed on one page.

links.description: The links related to the resource.

rel.description: How the link is related to the resource, up one level in the path or, if paginated, the previous / next page of information.

StartDate.description: The date of the recorded campaign traffic statistics

EndDate.description: The date of the recorded campaign traffic statistics

Clicks.description: The number of sponsored clicks for the campaign on the specified day

Impressions.description: The number of people who viewed the sponsored campaign on that day

Conversions.description: The number of applications resulting from direct clicks on your ad campaign on the specified day.

AveragePage.description: The ratio of ad clicks to impressions, or the click-through rate.

last_modified_timestamp.description: The timestamp when the job in milliseconds from the Unix epoch.

description.example: Do cool things with our data.

description_html.description: The job description in HTML format

url.description: The page to view the job details.

indeed_apply_data.description: The URL parameter string of the Indeed Apply data.

switchToBudgetOptimizationTarget.description: The budget optimization target. If you set `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set either the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetOnetimeLimit.description: A one time budget limit for the campaign. You cannot set `budgetOnetimeLimit` and `budgetMonthlyLimit` at the same time. If you set the `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetMonthlyLimit.description: A monthly budget limit for the campaign. You cannot set `budgetOnetimeLimit` and `budgetMonthlyLimit` at the same time. If you set the `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetDailyLimit.description: The daily budget limit for the campaign. If you set `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, do not set the `budgetDailyLimit`. It is automatically calculated.

budgetFirstMonthBehavior.description: First month behavior of monthly budget campaign.

maxCpc.description: Required when budgetOptimizationTarget is bidForClicks. If budgetOptimizationTarget is automatic, maxCpc is automatically calculated. Do not set this.

budgetOnetimeDuration.description: The duration of one time budget ads. Required when the `budgetOptimizationTarget` is automatic and the `budgetOnetimeLimit` is set.

name.description: The unique name of the campaign

trackingToken.description: A unique tracking token for this campaign

jobsToInclude.description: Choose to sponsor all jobs from this source or a subset of jobs. If you choose all, we ignore the fields that start with `jobs`.

jobsQuery.description: The keyword(s) of the job query

jobsTitle.description: The job titles to include in the query

jobsCompany.description: The hiring companies to include in the query

jobsLocation.description: The locations to include in the query

jobsLocationRadius.description: The job location radius. This field only accepts 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, or 100

jobsSource.description: Pass either a `jobSource` or `jobsSourceId`. This will be deprecated. Use `jobsSourceId` instead.

jobsSourceId.description: Pass either a `jobSource` or `jobsSourceId`. Each campaign only supports one `jobsSourceId`. If you have multiple job source IDs, create a separate campaign for each one. Use the `/v1/account` resource to get the `jobsSourceId`.

jobsToInclude.description: Choose to sponsor all jobs from this source or a subset of jobs. If you choose all, we ignore the fields that start with `jobs`.

jobsQuery.description: The keyword(s) of the job query

jobsTitle.description: The job titles to include in the query

jobsCompany.description: The hiring companies to include in the query

jobsLocation.description: The locations to include in the query

jobsLocationRadius.description: The job location radius. This field only accepts 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, or 100

budgetOptimizationTarget.description: The budget optimization target. If you set `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set either the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetOnetimeLimit.description: A one time budget limit for the campaign. You cannot set `budgetOnetimeLimit` and `budgetMonthlyLimit` at the same time. If you set the `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetMonthlyLimit.description: A monthly budget limit for the campaign. You cannot set `budgetOnetimeLimit` and `budgetMonthlyLimit` at the same time. If you set the `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, you must set the `budgetOnetimeLimit` or the `budgetMonthlyLimit`.

budgetDailyLimit.description: The daily budget limit for the campaign. If you set `budgetOptimizationTarget` to `AUTOMATIC`, do not set the `budgetDailyLimit`. It is automatically calculated.

budgetFirstMonthBehavior.description: First month behavior of monthly budget campaign. Defaults to `startNextMonthFullAmount`.

maxCpc.description: Required when budgetOptimizationTarget is bidForClicks. If budgetOptimizationTarget is automatic, maxCpc is automatically calculated. Do not set this.

budgetOnetimeDuration.description: The duration of one time budget ads. Required when the `budgetOptimizationTarget` is automatic and the `budgetOnetimeLimit` is set.
